text: Expression of <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> correlates with IFN-alpha responsiveness in Philadelphia chromosome positive chronic myelogenous leukemia .

This study evaluates ( i ) constitutive levels of oncogene and <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcripts in chronic phase CML patients and ( ii ) their modulations subsequent to in vivo therapy with rIFN-alpha 2c .

Peripheral blood mononuclear cells ( pbmc ) and bone marrow cells of 26 patients were examined for <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> c-myc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the hybrid bcr / abl mRNA levels .

text: Results indicated that ( i ) constitutive c-fos transcript levels are significantly higher in patients subsequently responding to IFN-alpha therapy ( p < 0.01 ) and positively correlated with the proportion of lymphocytes ( r = 0.6895 , p < 0.01 ) and negatively with the proportion of immature cells ( r = -0.568 , p < 0.01 ) contained in the pbmc preparations tested , ( ii ) constitutive mRNA levels of the hybrid bcr / abl , <extra_id_0> c-myc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> p53 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are positively correlated with each other , but failed to relate to disease parameters , and ( iii ) acute and chronic in vivo exposure to IFN-alpha is accompanied by upregulation of <extra_id_0> c-fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and downregulation of <extra_id_0> c-myc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA levels in responder patients .
